result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bryon Scott Van Dyke Jr.

records.addlTxt: Unpaid October 1 & November 1, 2022, attorney fees.  ($50.00 due per month)  This person may be released upon the payment of $100.00
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 21, 2022 at 10:45 am.

11:03 AM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris,  Defendant Bryon Scott Van Dyke Jr. not in court.  Attorney Jon Elton Stanek not in court.  Prosecuting attorney Michael Joseph Becker in court for the State of Wisconsin. Hall is called, DE does not appear.  Court reviews letter filed by Atty Stanek requesting to reschedule this matter. Court is unsure if DE was aware of this request.  Court authorizes warrant- STAYED pending confirmation from Atty Stanek that he informed his client that DE would not need to be present. JA to reach out to Atty Stanek to confirm communications with DE.  Adjourned at 11:06 AM.   OFF Record Discussion.  Court will STAY warrant until next court date, if DE does not appear warrant will be issued.  Court notes DE has not paid for Atty Fee for month of October, financial clerk to issue warrant for non payment. bph

filed by Atty Stanek, requesting to reschedule PLEAS scheduled for today at 11:00 AM.  Per SRN on 10/27/22-  Did Atty Stanek tell his client he didn't have to appear? If not, a warrant will be issued for non appearance by DE.  bph

9:57 AM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Defendant Bryon Scott Van Dyke Jr. in court.  Attorney Jon Elton Stanek in court for Bryon Scott Van Dyke Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Brian Thomas Smestad in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews file.  Atty Stanek states there is an agreement asking to schedule PLEAS. DE verified address and phone number.  Bond continues. Adjourned at 9:57 AM. bph
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 11:00 am.

records.addlTxt: Filed by DA's Office. km

- $250 cash bail on file. 

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Emily C.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats. THIS CONDITION SHALL ONLY BE EFFECTIVE UPON THE EXPIRATION OF A 72 HOUR NO CONTACT ORDER.


If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.
